list_definition.definition: feeling fear or being frightened (of a person, thing etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The child is not afraid of the dark
She was afraid to go to the dentist.
I’m afraid I don’t agree with you.
He was afraid of disappointing her.

list_ex_of_english: Although this idea touches on an interesting consideration, we are afraid that the notion of "meaning" is itself too imprecise to be really helpful.
They are not afraid to risk ridicule in the pursuit of true representation.
Perhaps no one is afraid of the working class because we no longer have a clear sense of who actually belongs to the working class.
Thus, men repress their own feelings, devalue femininity because of its emotional side, are afraid of women and disappointing in their relationships with them.
I think he was afraid what he might pass on to you.
Apart from physical dangers (falls, scalds, and so on), being ' at home ' may mean being lonely, isolated and afraid.
Both were afraid not only of alienating allies, but also of vagrancy and chaos within their domains.
We are afraid that we have no new insight to add to the centuries of philosophical debates.
